relevant_findings.fundus_examination: Uniform, yellow-white dots typical of fundus albipunctatus; reduced central retinal thickness (132/134 µm).
relevant_findings.faF_intensity: Severely reduced in the entire fundus; temporal macula/optic disk autoﬂuorescence index was 1.4 (right eye) and 1.6 (left eye).
relevant_findings.mfERG: Demonstrated reduced central and peripheral responses.

changes_over_time.visual_acuity: Decreased from 0.9 at age 8 to 0.5 at age 18.
changes_over_time.ffERG_rod_response: Progressively reduced from normal responses at age 10 to barely recordable at age 18 after standard dark adaptation.
changes_over_time.faF_intensity: Homogeneously reduced, did not change after prolonged dark adaptation.
